vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/c7ef1ece-a170-42e6-80fc-86889073f6e7">USA</keyword>         <topcClas>Economic conditions and indicators - Economics</topcClas>         <topcClas>Migration - Population, vital statistics and censuses</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) International Migration Statistics</i> include data on foreign and immigrant populations, foreign workers, migration flows and naturalisations for OECD member countries and others for a variety of periods from 1980 onwards.The data are presented in the following tables on Beyond 20/20 Web Data Server:<br> <br> <b>FDI, Private Transfers and Workers Remittances</b><br> This table contains statistics presented in millions of U.S. dollars for Foreign Direct Investment (FDI), private transfers, and workers remittances for 173 different countries from 1980 onwards.<br> <br> <b>Population and Labour Force by Duration of Stay</b><br> Population, labour force, and employment statistics are presented for 1995, (except for Australia - data from 1996, Canada - 1991 and the United States - 1990). The number of persons for each variable is provided in terms of duration of stay, origin, sex, and age. The countries covered are: Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, Finland, France, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, Swede, the United Kingdom, and the United States<br> <br> <b>Population and Labour Force by Level of Education</b><br> Population, labour force, and employment statistics are presented for 1995, (except for Australia - data from 1996, Canada - 1991 and the United States - 1990). The number of persons for each variable is provided in terms of level of education, origin, sex and age. The countries covered are: Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, Sweden, the United Kingdom, and the United States<br> <br> <b>Flows of Foreigners by Country of Origin</b><br> Data on the inflows and outflow of people to and from OECD Member countries from 1980 onwards are presented in this table. Data are provided for 94 origin countries and the following destination countries: Australia, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, France, Germany, Japan, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Norway, Sweden Switzerland, the United Kingdom, and the United States. <br> <br> <b>GDP and GDP per capita</b><br> Statistics for gross domestic product (GDP) and GDP per capita for 187 different countries from 1980 onwards are presented in this table. Data are provided in millions of constant and current U.S. dollars and purchasing power parities (PPPs).<br> <br> <b>Foreign Trade by Partner Country</b><br> Statistics on the total import and exports between 64 different countries from 1980 onwards is presented in this table. Data is presented in millions of U.S. dollars.<br> <br> <b>Employment by Sex and Industry Division</b><br> Employment statistics by sex and industry division for 76 different countries for the period 1980-1995 are presented in this table. For each country, the number of employed persons is given by sex, source of the data (survey or official estimates) and by industry division, according to the International Standard Industrial Classification (ISIC) Revision 2. Countries covered include: Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, the Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Korea, Luxembourg, Mexico, the Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, the United Kingdom, and the United States, plus 47 other non-member countries<br> <br> <b>Employment by Industry Division</b><br> Employment statistics for immigrants by industry for 1995 are presented in this table, (with the exception of Australia - data from 1996 and the US - data from 1990). For each country, the number of employed persons is provided in terms of origin, industry employed within, sex, and age. The countries covered are: Australia, Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, Sweden, and the United Kingdom<br> <br> <b>Naturalisations by Country of Previous Nationality</b><br> This table contains the naturalisation statistics for the following OECD Member countries from 1986 onwards - Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Japan, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Norway, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, the United Kingdom, and the United States. Data are provided by 87 origin countries.<br> <br> <b>Employment by Occupation</b><br> Employment statistics for immigrants by occupation for 1995 are presented in this table (except for Australia - data from 1996, Canada - 1991 and the United States - 1990). For each country, the number of employed persons is provided in terms of origin, occupation, sex, and age. The countries covered are: Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, France, Germany, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, the United Kingdom, and the United States<br> <br> <b>Official Development Assistance by Partner Country</b><br> Statistics from 1990 onwards on Official Development Assistance (ODA) from OECD Member countries to a list of 204 countries are provided in this table. Data are available in millions of U.S. dollars. The OECD donor countries are: Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Portugal, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, the United Kingdom, and the United States<br> <br> <b>Population and Labour Force by Country of Origin</b><br> This table contains data for 1995 (except for Australia - data from 1996, Canada - 1991 and the United States - 1990) on immigrant population statistics in the general population, in the labour force, employed, and unemployed. These populations are provided in terms of origin, origin country, sex, and age. Countries covered are: Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, Swede, the United Kingdom, and the United States<br> <br> <b>Population by Age and Sex</b><br> Population statistics from 1980-1995 are presented for 51 different countries in this table. Data are provided in terms of sex and age. The countries covered are: Argentina, Australia, Austria, Belarus, Belgium, Brazil, Bulgaria, Canada, Chile, China, the Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hong Kong, Hungary, Iceland, India Indonesia, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Japan, Korea, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malaysia, Mexico, Moldova, the Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, the Philippines, Poland, Portugal, Romania, the Russian Federation, Singapore, the Slovak Republic, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Thailand, Turkey, the Ukraine, the United Kingdom, and the United States<br> <br> <b>Components of Total Population Growth</b><br> Population statistics on total population, average population, beginning and end of year population, foreign births and deaths, migration, etc. for 1980 onwards are presented in this table. The countries covered are: Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, the Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Korea, Luxembourg, Mexico, the Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, the United Kingdom, and the United States<br> <br> <b>Employment by Professional Status</b><br> This table contains employment statistics for immigrants by professional for 1995 onwards, (except for Australia - data from 1996 and US - data from 1990). For each country, the number of employed persons is provided in terms of origin, professional status, sex, and age. The countries covered are Australia, Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, Sweden, the United Kingdom, and the United States<br> <br> <b>Stocks of Foreign Born Population by Country of Origin</b><br> This table contains statistics on stocks of foreign-born population from 1980 onwards. Data are provided by origin, sex, and 107 origin countries. Data are provided for the following destination countries: Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Norway, Portugal, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, the United Kingdom, and the United States<br> <br> <b>Summary Tables</b><br> This summary table contains data for 1980 onwards on the following variables: inflows and outflows of foreigners, asylum seekers, stocks of foreigners and foreign born, and naturalisations. Countries covered are: Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Norway, Portugal, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, the United Kingdom, and the United States<br> <br> <b>Duration of Unemployment</b><br> Unemployment statistics for immigrants for 1995 (except for Australia where data from 1996), is presented in this table. For each country, the number of unemployed persons is provided in terms of origin, duration of unemployment, sex, and age. The countries covered are: Australia, Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, Sweden, and the United Kingdom<br> <br> These data were first provided by the UK Data Service in May 2004. The UK Data Service web site includes further information on its <i>OECD International Migration Statistics</i> holdings, including a <a href=" http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/migration-statistics.aspx" title=" OECD International Migration Statistics dataset user guide">dataset user guide</a> and details of <a href=" http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/oecd/ims/2009-10" title=" OECD International Migration Statistics latest database updates">latest database updates</a>.<br> <br> <b>Citation:</b> The bibliographic citation for the database is: Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (<i>{YYYY}</i>): International Migration Statistics (<i>{Ed. Data download: YYYY-MM}</i>). Mimas, University of Manchester. DOI: <i>{edition specific doi - e.g. <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/oecd/ims/2009-10">http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/oecd/ims/2009-10</a>}</i>. <br> <br> <b>Alternative DOIs:</b> <a href="http://www.oecd-ilibrary.org/trade/data/oecd-statistics-on-international-trade-in-services_tis-data-en" title ="10.1787/mig-data-en">10.1787/mig-data-en</a> (to access via OECD.Stat subscription).<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The database covers:<br> <ul><li>international and population migration</li><li>immigration and immigrants</li> <li>emigration and emigrants</li><li>gross national product</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd>The <i>OECD International Migration Statistics</i> run from 1980 onwards.</timePrd>         <nation>Multi-nation</nation>         <geogUnit>Countries</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Administrative units (geographical/political)</anlyUnit>         <universe>Cross-national; National</universe>         <universe>Countries covered include: Argentina, Australia, Austria, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Belgium, Brazil, Bulgaria, Canada, Chile, China, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hong Kong, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Japan, Democratic People's Republic of Korea, Republic of Korea, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malaysia, Mexico, Republic of Moldova, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Philippines, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Russian Federation, Singapore, Slovakia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Thailand, Turkey, Ukraine, United Kingdom, United States.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Aggregate (macro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Time Series</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>updated annually</timeMeth>         <sampProc>See documentation for details</sampProc>         <collMode>For details of methodology, please see the <a href=" http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/migration-statistics.aspx" title=" OECD International Migration Statistics"> dataset user guide</a>.</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting used.
